content:
Diagnosis:	Localized tubulocystic renal cell carcinoma, right kidney

Management:	15 Mar 2024 Right partial nephrectomy

Histology:	Tubulocystic renal cell carcinoma, 3.2cm, confined to kidney. Margins clear. KDM5C mutation detected.

Current Situation:	First post-operative oncology assessment

I reviewed [redacted name] today following his recent right partial nephrectomy for localized renal cell carcinoma. He has made an excellent recovery from surgery with minimal post-operative pain and good wound healing. His renal function remains stable with creatinine 98 umol/L (pre-operative baseline 92).

He is otherwise fit and well with no significant past medical history apart from well-controlled hypertension on ramipril. He works as an accountant and has already returned to work part-time. He lives with his wife and maintains an active lifestyle including regular cycling.

On examination today, his surgical wounds are well-healed. His blood pressure is 138/82 and heart rate 72 regular. Chest is clear and abdomen soft with no masses or tenderness.

I have reviewed his imaging and histology in detail. The CT chest/abdomen/pelvis from 1 March 2024 showed a 3.4cm mass in the right kidney with no evidence of local invasion or metastatic disease. Post-operative histology confirms a tubulocystic renal cell carcinoma, completely excised with clear margins. Molecular analysis has detected a KDM5C mutation.

Given the localized nature of the disease and complete surgical excision, I have recommended surveillance rather than adjuvant therapy. We will arrange CT chest/abdomen/pelvis in 6 months' time and see him back in clinic with the results. I have provided written information about symptoms to watch for and contact details for the specialist nursing team.

He understands the surveillance plan and has no immediate concerns. His GP will continue to monitor his blood pressure and renal function.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: tubulocystic renal cell carcinoma, 3.2cm, margins clear

cancer_timeline.value: CT chest/abdomen/pelvis shows 3.4cm mass in right kidney, no evidence of local invasion or metastatic disease
Histology confirms tubulocystic renal cell carcinoma, completely excised with clear margins

patient_facts.value: Stable renal function with creatinine 98 umol/L
Surgical wounds well-healed, blood pressure 138/82, heart rate 72 regular, chest clear, abdomen soft
Returned to part-time work as accountant, maintains active lifestyle including cycling

status_updates.value: Localized tubulocystic renal cell carcinoma successfully treated with partial nephrectomy. Excellent post-operative recovery with no evidence of residual disease.
Recommended surveillance rather than adjuvant therapy
Review in clinic with CT results in 6 months
